pullRequest.title: Manage threads explicitly instead of using executors - 1/3
pullRequest.bodyText:
Issue #, if available:
#105
Description of changes:

Create a singleton thread provider which provisions threads and handles exceptions by writing to a queue. (The queue is currently a dummy placeholder for correct error handling)
Manage the RcaScheduler thread ourselves instead of using an executor and a separate exception handling thread. This exception handling thread led to the spike in master CPU utilization.
Manage the RcaController as a separate thread instead of using 3 scheduled tasks. It removes creation of 3 exception handling threads as well.

With all of the changes, there is no change in behavior other than the fact we don't see a spike in master CPU utilization. We can improve the error handling with per-task error handling if need be in the next set of commits.
All threads die if they throw an exception that the thread itself is not catching and this leads to that thread dying.
Tests:
Tested on opendistro, unit tests pass.

nodes.bodyText: Why are we doing whitespace changes again? Can we add this to checkstyle?
This is not threadsafe. You can just initialize this in a static block or pass this object into other constructors. Lets not use a singleton.
We should just poll on the queue, so that we handle errors as they are generated.

We should just block if the queue is full. We should emit metrics on errors and these metrics need to be accurate. The component will be dead if it hits an exception. Should we restart the process if we run into exceptions?

nodes.bodyText: I was thinking that we move the entire thread creation into a helper class. The thread creators should use that to create threads using few parameters
I see that the users of the field are deleted. we should remove this too ? Did I miss something ?
We are catching exception here. How are we reporting that a thread shutdown because of exception in the stats collector ?

I was also thinking that this will have a method say runningThreadCount and expectedThreadCount which will be polled by PeriodicSamplers. In normal case these should be equal but in case a thread dies we would know. It should not be a point emission (emit once and never again). It should be emitted until the problem is fixed. We should be able to see in the fleet if there are threads that are dead now and requires an Agent restart.
